ul.li1: 1Hear this, O priests!
Give heed, O house of Israel!
Listen, O house of the king!
ul.li2: Because the judgment applies to you;
ul.li1: because you have been a snare for Mizpah,
ul.li2: and a net spread out on Tabor;
ul.li1: 2they dug a deep pitHebrew uncertain in Shittim,
ul.li2: but I am a punishment for all of them.
ul.li1: 3I myself know Ephraim,
ul.li2: and Israel is not hidden from me;
ul.li1: because now you have played the whore, O Ephraim—
ul.li2: Israel is defiled.
ul.li1: 4Their deeds do not permit them
ul.li2: to return them to God.
ul.li1: Because a spirit of whoredom is in their midst,
ul.li2: they do not know Yahweh.
ul.li1: 5The pride of Israel testifies against him,Literally “against his face;” see 7:10
ul.li2: and Israel and Ephraim stumble in their guilt,
ul.li1: 6With their flocksHebrew “flock” and herdsHebrew “herd” they will go
ul.li2: to seek Yahweh, but they will not find him;
ul.li1: 7They have dealt faithlessly with Yahweh
ul.li2: because they have borne illegitimate children.
ul.li1: Now the new moon will devour them with their fields.
8Blow the hornHebrew “shofar” in Gibeah,
ul.li2: the trumpet in Ramah.
ul.li1: Sound the alarm in Beth-aven;
ul.li2: look behind you, Benjamin.
ul.li1: 9Ephraim will be a desolation
ul.li2: in the day of punishment;
ul.li1: among the tribes of Israel
ul.li2: I will reveal what is true.
ul.li1: 10The princes of Judah have become
ul.li2: like those who remove a landmark;
ul.li1: on them I will pour out
ul.li2: my wrath like water.
ul.li1: 11Ephraim is oppressed,
ul.li2: crushed in judgment,
ul.li1: because he was determined
ul.li2: to go after filth.Hebrew uncertain; another possible translation is “that he follows human commands”
ul.li1: 12But I am like a maggot to Ephraim
ul.li2: and like rottenness to the house of Judah.
ul.li1: 13And when Ephraim saw his illness,
ul.li2: and Judah his wound,
ul.li1: Ephraim went to Assyria,
ul.li2: he sent to the great king.Some translate literally “King Jareb” (see the NASB, NKJV)
ul.li1: But he was unable to cure you
ul.li2: and heal your wound.
ul.li1: 14Because I will be like a lion to Ephraim
ul.li2: and like a fierce strong lion to the house of Judah.
ul.li1: I myself will tear and I will go;
ul.li2: I will carry off, and there is no one who delivers.
ul.li1: 15I will return againLiterally “I will go, I will return” to my place
ul.li2: until they acknowledge their guilt
in their distress they will searchOr “they will beg favor of” me.
